natural solution: First, we use the distributive property to expand the first two factors: \begin{align} 6(x+2)(x+3) &= (6\cdot x + 6 \cdot 2) (x+3)\\ &=(6x+12)(x+3) \end{align}We use the distributive property again by adding the product of $6x+12$ and $x$ to the product of $6x+12$ and 3: \begin{align}

(6x+12)(x+3) &= (6x+12) \cdot x +(6x+12) \cdot 3\\ &= x(6x+12) + 3(6x+12) \end{align}We use the distributive property again and combine like terms: \begin{align} x(6x+12) + 3(6x+12) &= 6x^2 + 12x + 18x+ 36\\
